itemDescription: British Anglican bishop; Bishop of Barking

wikipedia_page.main: Peter Hill (born 4 February 1950) is a retired Church of England bishop who served as Bishop of Barking (an area bishop in the Diocese of Chelmsford), 2014–2021. He was previously Archdeacon of Nottingham, 2007–2014.

response: * Peter Hill (pianist) (born 1948), British pianist and musicologist
* Peter Hill (Paralympian) (born 1957), Australian Paralympic swimmer and athlete
* Peter Hill (entrepreneur) (born 1964), Australian skateboarder, entrepreneur and media producer
* Ployer Peter Hill (1894–1935), known as Peter, American test pilot
* Peter Hill (journalist) (born 1945), British former editor of the UK newspaper Daily Express
* Peter Hill (bishop) (born 1950), British bishop of Barking
* Peter Hill (writer) (active 2003), British author of Stargazing: Memoirs of a Young Lighthouse Keeper
* Peter Hill (civil servant), British civil servant
* Peter Hill-Wood (1936–2018), British businessman and football club chairman

|align="center"| 25 July 2014 ||align="center"| 4 August 2021 || Peter Hill || Previously Archdeacon of Nottingham;Diocese of Southwell & Nottingham – Archdeacon of Nottingham to become Bishop (Accessed 2 May 2014) retired effective 4 August 2021.
